job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Ashland, MA
pros:
Get done early in the morning, get to leave before nine.
Sometimes they have snacks
Mostly working by yourself and no dealing with costumers
The co-workers are very nice.
The people in the office are nice too. Some had trouble with the manager but I never did.
Helps pay for college
cons:
They overwork you most of the time for the pay given.
Friends of mine work way easier jobs like let’s say at a clothes store or a restaurant and make more than me.
It makes you sweat, they say it’s a paid workout but it’s really a paid back breaker. Your absolutely forced to lift with your back not your kneees due to the belt positioning.
Sometimes the drivers get mad, it’s as if the driver is a customer and they get mad. Most drivers are nice though.
Very depressing vibe. I get tired of hearing the same thing everyday about how hard their day has been.
Very dirty environment, wear a white shirt and it will be absolutely black by the time you leave.
Their is a section in which it is Ice cold during the winter. It is as if you are working outside. Your hands and toes will freeze. Make sure to wear 2 socks and bring gloves. It’s like being outside in the cold but with no wind. I also had to work outside, but I personally didn’t mind because I didn’t have to scan.
Is not a place in which you build out of work connections or friendships
The pay is 14.50 at my place. You’ll make about 300ish a week. Not survivable. People made more with unemployment money.
You will have no idea how the company works. Everyone in the offices also seem to be so time limited so you won’t even know when to ask.
Very chaotic for about 80+% of days.
They don’t have a good water fountain, you’ll be forced to bring in bottled water.
The time is not very consistent, especially during winter. This is understandable though.
If they put you on the split during peak. I recommend quitting. I was on it a few times and because of all the PVD packages, I would have nightmares about my job. I would literally wake up during the middle of the night because of what I’m afraid of going through tomorrow. I luckily didn’t have to split the whole peak. I don’t think I’d still be working there if I had too.
Your gonna look like trash, you’ll get acne because of all the dirt on your face. Your eyes will become baggy. You will also become weaker and look a little malnourished, this is if you don’t bring food.

Despite all this, Do I recommend? The Awnser is a surprising yes. This obviously depends on your options. If your one of those people with no degree or no luck finding a job with your degree there are many who became a drivers after working pre-load.
Thing is who knows how long it’s takes to go from being a pre-loader to being a driver. One of my co-workers has been waiting over two years. My guess is it takes about five because it doesn't look like he’ll be a driver anytime soon. This job also helps pay for college, which is the reason I’m still doing it.

Good luck:)

review_title: Could be a great company to work for.....
pros: Great union benefits and there's always work.
cons: There is always work! lol, slave drivers for sure. A day off? Whats that? Family time? Never heard of it? The phrase you will here often, UPS IS LIFE, is meant to take literal. Back breaking too....the requirements say 75lbs but you will regularly be expected to deliver 150lb plus irregular shaped objects of shorts by yourself up flights of stairs to apartments or businesses by yourself. the trucks are dirty all the time and you are constantly breathing in dust and dirt. I actually contracted ringworm. took weeks to get rid of. Good luck finding a place to use the bathroom during covid while you are out driving all day usually 12 hr days. The manager at my facility is a total jerk and 90% of the drivers hate him. He makes our life HELL. We have all complained to the ethics hotline and nothing has been done. The training is like HELL week in a boot camp and you learn most of what you need on the job is you manage to pass. DOG BITES are a very real danger. when its hot, its HOTT we have no A/C and the trucks get like sweat boxes and when its cold it is COLD. No insulation in the trucks at all. We get rained on alot and work never stops. When it gets darks fast due to time changes we have to work extra hours in the dark looking for addresses which really sucks when people dont have visible addresses posted. You have to decide if its the right house by the neighbors address or take it back to the facility as a non deliver which means they are just going to put it back on your truck tomorrow and then your going to have to answer to the boss on why you brought it back! if you do deliver it and it ends up being the wrong address, your going to get yelled at anyways for a misdeliver and the customer complaining that they didn't receive their package. your job is to deliver every package they shove into your truck every morning. If you are lucky enough to finish your deliveries early, you don't get to go home to your family. You have to help the next smuck whos been goofing off all day catch up on his deliveries. They don't admit it out loud but they pressure you to work through your breaks. They hate replacing uniforms and want you to wear yours until it literally has holes. I was issued 2 uniforms which I wash mine daily. I could go on but I think I've said enough.

pros: One of the best companies you could work for! I am always telling myself. & everyone else that I wish I had considered UPS years ago? It’s one of the only organizations left that provides their employees with top of the line benefits, a pension, union protection (unless you go into management; BUT, you CAN GO BACK) promotes from within the same location due to seniority typically, but as long as you’re clear that you have ambition to keep going with your management team, they’ll support you! Also, the pay is top notch for anyone, especially when you don’t have to have any post-secondary education to work there, yet they will pay for you to do any education after only a few months! If you are smart enough for this you can potentially use the temp job “back to school benefits” and then you get rehired in their number one diver position starting at $100K without ever touching a package!
cons: Physically demanding, stressful situations, some interesting supervisors who should not be in management! The hours are slightly weird; I don’t know why they are that way? Need to be able to adjust to changing environments, it’s FREEZING cold in the HUB, lack of availability to contact anyone in your management team for emergencies, lack of communication between employees for cultural growth; likely due to the seasonal hires only being there for money & make it clear they’re going to leave! Some gossip, if you’re a woman who is slightly attractive, you’re gonna be a favorite of the other departments...USE THIS FOR PEOPLE TO KNOW YOU!
